intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Hmph. So the little snake has slithered out of our grasp once more... How did that ragtag team manage to make it through the Wind Tribe village?! One of their ranks should have lost a leg or at least an arm by now! Yet they are all in perfect health and high spirits. How utterly disappointing. King Garon must be furious. As his advisor, it is my duty to set things right. Luckily, their next stop is a fitting location for Corrin's fall from grace. The Eternal Stairway, rumored to lead straight to hell. Heh, it's too perfect! I wonder how many friends and loved ones our little prince/princess will lose there... Prepare to drown in your despair, Lord/Lady Corrin. Your king and I look forward to feasting upon your cries of agony!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Ugh, so many stairs. Just a shot in the dark here, but is this the Eternal Stairway?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: It is. Once we make it through here, we'll be near the Hoshidan castle. Soldiers will undoubtedly be awaiting our arrival, but this path is our only option. We'll have to break through their numbers by sheer force of will.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: And so we shall... Well, let's get on with it.

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: M-milord/milady! We have an emergency!!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Let me guess... Hoshidan soldiers?

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: Um, well, yes! But... I mean, no? It's a little... Oh boy. So! The thing is... Um...

intro.speaker: Jakob
intro.line: Quiet, Felicia. Your stammering isn't helping anyone. Milord/Milady, we scouted ahead as ordered. We found a great many Hoshidan soldiers... All dead. The stairs up ahead are littered with their corpses.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Gods... What happened?!

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: W-we're not sure. They all appear to be healthy, strong warriors. And yet there's not a single survivor. It's...it's awful to behold.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Perhaps Father sent another unit of Nohrian soldiers ahead of us...

intro.speaker: Jakob
intro.line: Highly unlikely, milord/milady. There's no way they could have passed us unnoticed. The only other route into Hoshido requires crossing the Bottomless Canyon... But they would have had to circle back, so we still would have gotten here first.

intro.speaker: Camilla
intro.line: A tragedy to be sure, but this works out quite nicely for us. Having our enemy taken care of before we even arrive is a huge boon. We should take advantage of this and get going before more troops arrive.

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: Agreed. These soldiers would have fallen anyway—better that it's not by our hands. We should be grateful that someone saved us the trouble of a tiring battle.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I suppose. But...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Huh?! What's that sound?

intro.speaker: Faceless
intro.line: GRRRAAARRRGHH!!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Faceless! Here?!

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: Oh no, oh no, oh no! There are too many of them, and they're headed right for us!

intro.speaker: Jakob
intro.line: Damn! So this is what befell those Hoshidan soldiers. We must not let the same thing happen to us, Felicia, follow me!

intro.speaker: Faceless
intro.line: RAAAAARGH!!

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: Take that! AND THAT!

intro.speaker: Faceless
intro.line: Grrraaargh...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: It's no use! There are too many of them! Everyone, pull back! We can't win this battle!

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: We can't leave! They've got us surrounded!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: We're trapped...

intro.speaker: Camilla
intro.line: Oh, Father... Did you really have to send quite so many of these beasties?

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: Camilla, this is no joking matter!

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Something's not right... Even Father wouldn't dispatch this many Faceless to one location. There's more at play here than we know.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: We'll figure it out later! For now, we need to concentrate on making it out alive. All we can do is carve through the Faceless and head for the top of the stairs. Everyone, watch each other's backs. I won't lose any of you! I WON'T!

battle.speaker: Azura
battle.line: Listen carefully, Corrin. We cannot possibly vanquish this many Faceless. There's no end in sight. We must try to get past them as quickly as possible.

end.speaker: Faceless
end.line: RAAARGH!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Dammit! There really is no end in sight! Ugh!

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Corrin!!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I'm...I'm OK, Azura. But I'm not sure we'll be able to make it back up the stairs like this...

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: The Faceless seem to be concentrating their attacks on you, Corrin. I've never seen anything quite like it.

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: ... Corrin, go on ahead while we fend them off. That's an order.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: What?! No! I won't leave you!

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: You are our leader, Corrin. Think with your head, not your heart. No matter what happens to us, you mustn't fall here. All of Nohr is counting on you. Leave this mess to us and get out of here! We'll buy enough time to escape. I won't say it again, little prince/princess. as the crown prince of Nohr, my word is law. Go, NOW!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: But, Xander! I can't just leave you to... I...I can't let you...

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Xander is right. If we're to end this war and bring peace to the world, we can't let you die here. You are the fated hero, Corrin. The Yato chose you for a reason. So please trust us. Get out of here while you still can.

end.speaker: Faceless
end.line: GRRRAAAAARRRGH!!

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Run, Corrin!!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Azura... OK. I trust you, and I will do as you say. We WILL meet again. We must. Until then...good-bye.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: *pant...pant...pant...* I finally made it up the Eternal Stairway... Hoshido...is just ahead... I hope everyone is all right. Please gods, let them be all right...

end.speaker: Faceless
end.line: GRRRAAAAWR!!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Huh?! More Faceless! How can this be?!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Lilith! NO!!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Why, Lilith? Why?! Why did you risk your life for me? This can't be happening... Hang in there, Lilith!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Lilith... You're...

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: *cough* It would seem the Astral Dragon Moro has taken pity on me. He's chosen to...let me return to my human form...for my last few—

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: No, Lilith! Don't you dare say it! I...I forbid it! You aren't allowed to die, Lilith! Please! I need you to live...

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: I'm sorry, milord/milady... For the first and last time...I can't follow your orders. But please...please don't cry for me. I'm so grateful I was able to protect you. It's only fitting. After all, you saved my life too, all those years ago. More than saving me, you gave me a place to call home...a family...someone to... I'll never forget all of our happy memories together. I die without regrets.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Lilith, don't go... We've come so far! The war is nearly won! Don't make me say good-bye...

end.speaker: Lilith
end.line: Please, don't cry, milord/milady. Let me see you smile once more... I...I always adored you, Corrin. You've meant so much to me. Keep me in your heart, and I'll always... I'll always be with you... ... ...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: ...Lilith? LILITH!! NOOO!! Why, gods? WHY?! Why does someone as pure as Lilith have to die, that I might live? How can I go on...knowing she's dead because...*sob* because of me... *sob*

end.speaker: Faceless
end.line: GRRRAAAAWR!!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: More? Now?! But, I..

end.speaker: Faceless
end.line: GRRRAAAAARGH!!

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: It's all right, Corrin. We are at your side once more.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Xander!! You're alive!

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Yes, thanks to Xander's incomparable skill, we somehow made it out alive. We're sorry to have kept you waiting.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I'm so happy to see you both. ... But...Lilith... She...

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: What's happened? Why is she... No! Please, no...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Lilith... She saved me from the Faceless. Yet another life lost because of me... I want only to end this war...to stop all of the death and destruction...and yet... How...how could this... *sob...sob...*

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: ... Pull yourself together, Corrin. There is no time for tears.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Xander?

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: Crying will not bring her back, nor is it what she would have wanted for you.

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: Listen, Corrin. I know this sounds harsh, but there's nothing you can do. Falling into misery and blaming yourself will not change anything. Lilith paid the ultimate price because she believes in you, as do we all. Do not tarnish the beauty of her sacrifice by letting it cloud your judgment. This is a war. If you let one death stop you from fighting with all your heart... We will not prevail. Do you really wish for her to have died in vain? Or for your sorrow to put those of us who remain in danger?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: No, but... It hurts so much...

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: The final showdown is still to come. This is just the beginning. There's a good chance that more of us will die in the battle that lie ahead. Elise, Leo, Camilla... If any of us die in the days ahead, you must keep fighting. You must stand tall, swallow your sorrow, and fight until the bitter end. If you waver, your troops will waver too. You must not allow that to happen. As he/she who wields the legendary Yato, that is your divine responsibility. So dry those tears, little prince/princess. There's work to be done.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Xander...

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: Fight without fear or hesitation, and you will lead this world into the light.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Without fear or hesitation... But how, Xander? How do you do it?

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: By searching your soul and finding strength in your resolve. That is how. No matter what happens, don't ever stop fighting. Isn't that what Lilith would want?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Lilith... You're right, Xander. As always. Before she died, Lilith told me not to cry for her, to smile instead. I know it would upset her to see me like this. For her, I will carry on. Thank you, Brother. I feel much better now. I promise not to waver, no matter what.

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: There's that smile Lilith was so keen to see. I'm proud of you, little brother/sister. Now, back to the task at hand. We cannot afford to stall here forever.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Right. ... Lilith... We're going to lay you to rest now, but then we must keep pressing forward. I'll see you on the other side, my friend. We'll ride horses and chat about the good times we've had since we last met. I'm sorry to leave you in this place, but the path to peace is finally within reach. From here, we're a stone's throw away from the Hoshidan castle. It won't be long now. Please keep watching over me, old friend. Just like you always did. I hope you know how much I loved you, and that I always will. ...Good-bye, Lilith.

end.speaker: Iago
end.line: So the little flying rat died, did she? I always did despise Lilith. What an annoying way to go, protecting her master from her rightful torment. If it weren't for her intervention, I could have made Corrin suffer even more! Ah well, at least that's one less shield for her to hide behind. Poor Corrin. I have only just begun digging your pit of despair. Soon you will find yourself lost in its infinite darkness for all eternity... Your time is nearly up, false prince/princess... Enjoy your last moments of joy...
